description: Borrowed from French doctrinaire, from doctrine  +â€Ž -aire.

adjectives.description: doctrinaire (comparative more doctrinaire, superlative most doctrinaire)

entries.meaning: Stubbornly holding on to an idea without concern for practicalities or reality.
A person who stubbornly holds to a philosophy or opinion regardless of its feasibility.
(historical) In France, in 1815-30, one of a school who desired a constitution like that of Britain.
